hints: Three-dimensional art form

Often has four movements

A Japanese literary form
Combines prose with haiku
Basho was a master of this form
A long narrative poem
Often about a heroic figure
The 'Iliad' and 'Odyssey' are famous examples
A form of drama
Ends with the downfall of the main character
Often involves serious themes like death and fate
A form of drama
Intended to be humorous
Ends with a happy resolution
A literary genre
Uses humor and irony to criticize society
Often targets human folly or vices
Written or spoken language in its ordinary form
Not in a poetic form
Includes novels, short stories, and essays
A single line of poetry
Can also refer to a stanza
The opposite of prose
A speech given by a character alone on stage
Used to reveal inner thoughts
